string-array.name: title
string-array.item: Quick Chicken Nuggets
Mediterranean Chicken and Pasta
Indian-Spiced Chicken Thighs
Maryland Fried Chicken with Creamy Gravy
Chicken with Artichokes
Crockpot Lasagna
Buffalo Chicken Drumsticks with Blue Cheese Dip
Chicken with Sourdough-Mushroom Stuffing
In-Your-Sleep Chili

string-array.name: desc
string-array.item: These breaded chicken tenders are served with a mustard and mayonnaise mixture for dipping. Serve steamed green beans with this recipe for a quick-and-easy family meal.
Artichoke hearts, garlic, oregano, olives, roasted sweet peppers, and feta cheese flavor the pasta for this 30-minute dinner.
Dinner guests dont have to know how simple this crockpot roast is to make. Simmer pork with cranberry sauce and spices, then serve with tart apples for a delicious medley of textures.
What sets this fried chicken apart from the typical recipe is that milk is added after partially cooking the chicken so the pieces simmer rather than fry.
Using frozen artichokes in this Italian-style chicken dish makes assembling the casserole recipe convenient because the inedible parts of the vegetable are removed.
Meaty chicken pieces simmer with dried fruit in a spiced wine mixture for a richly flavored winter dish.
Italian sausage, basil, and oregano season this slow cooker chili.

Dress up chicken and stuffing with big chunks of sourdough bread and mushrooms. Finish off this slow cooked main dish with fresh gremolata. The lemon-peel, parsley, and chopped-walnut topping give it a fantastic citrusy flavor.
Nuts and cranberries fill these simple baked apples that cook in your slow-cooker. Top them with Sea Salt Caramel Sauce and, if you like, a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

string-array.name: recipe
string-array.item:
1 cup bread crumbs
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
1/4 cup Dijon mustard
1/3 cup light mayonnaise
1 1/2 pounds chicken tenders, cut into 1-inch pieces
3/4 pound green beans, washed, trimmed and steamed

Heat oven to broil.
Coat baking rack with nonstick cooking spray.
Place rack over baking sheet; set aside.
Stir together bread crumbs, garlic powder and thyme in a pie plate; set aside.
Stir together mustard and mayonnaise.
Reserve about 1/2 cup of mustard mixture for dipping sauce.
Brush chicken pieces with remaining mustard mix; place chicken in pie plate with bread crumb mixture, spooning crumbs on top of pieces and pressing to adhere.
Transfer to prepared baking rack. Broil for 10 minutes or until cooked through.
Serve with reserved dipping sauce and green beans on the side.
